review_url_name_comment: What a welcoming sign to Wendover. Wendover Will is lit up with bright neon and waving hello to all who enter town. This is a historic marker and a blast from the past. It is nice to see a little bit of old school

Wendover Will has been a staple of Wendover and its communities ever since I can remember, even as a kid in the 80s. I am super stoked that West Wendover city has re-lighted the ol' bloke! The only drawback is there isnt any parking that I would consider "safe".
I was delighted to stop and read the plaques with the rich history behind Wendover Will and its creator-namesake. Kudos, West Wendover!
At the edge of the parking area were quite a few plaques on pedestals with LOTS of historical information on them! Also, extremely scenic area.
Great welcome sign. There was a deer grazing at the base of the statue, too. Although we liked Will, the gaming there was pitiful. (Will should have a sign: Empty yer pockets, here, pardner!)

I remember him at the edge of town by a casino, drawing in tourists with his light up neon. Someone spent about $200,000 spent to restore and move him down the boulevard. Fun to see especially for nostalgic reasons or kids.
Took a long walk to the west side of town and checked out Wendover Will. Took a few pictures. It's cool that they kept the big neon sign. Beautiful view from there.

review_url_name_title: He's standing in the middle of the road blocking traffic.
review_url_name_comment: Not sure when he was built, or made but I understand it one time he used to wave at people coming into town.

Wendover Will, or referred to as Bendover Bill by the gamblers is a must stop and see. Interesting, at the base of the sign are bricks inscribed with the names and dates of many of the racers that were on the Bonneville Salt Flats. Another place to see is the Enola Gay hangar at the airport. A lot of history in Wendover
It is located on the west end of town on the main street through Wendover. It has been there for years, and is kind of cool to look at, take a picture and not much else.

review_url_name_title: Blast from the past. I had to take his photo!
review_url_name_comment: Big signs from another era are such a blast from the past, that I had to stop I and take his photo! Las Vegas has a museum dedicated to old signs like this.
Lots of parking, accessible via the parking area. Great place for pictures and they encourage selfies and actually give you information as to where to send them. Areal piece of history.

review_url_name_title: Very interesting story connected with this. Very Coool and was fun to see.,
review_url_name_comment: Very interesting story connected with this. Very Coool and was fun to see. Way at the end of the strip

review_url_name_title: Great place to get out of the car and walk around
review_url_name_comment:
This is a cool, old remnant that demonstrates how interesting it must have been to travel back in the 50's and earlier. Beautiful neon welcoming you into this border town.
Wendover is usually a gas and snack stop for us, but we always make sure we at least drive by Will. There is a grassy area to the west and a few plaques. The only issue is I'm not sure where you can legally stop to get a few photos. The road isn't busy but it didn't look like there is an approved area.

review_url_name_title: a truly historic icon marker and traveller stop for photo
review_url_name_comment: Wendover Willie - Nickname given to it from a time well into the late 1950's. The memories rooted into my mind of the many times my parents took us as kids on drives are truly PRICELESS in our De Soto sedan and yes, stopping by what was then THE STATELINE casino for a lunch. A treat indeed for us and for you? A travel back in time through a picture.. Enjoy :)

Iconic statue welcoming visitors to this remote outpost. Unfortunately, upon my arrival it was extremely windy - limiting my visit. There’s some interesting history behind Wendover Will. Cute if you’re into classic Americana. A visit to the adjacent Victory Highway is recommended.
We had a wonderful time celebrating a friend's 60th Birthday! Good food, good friends and alot of laughs.
Rainbow Wendover cheapest rooms. Excellent dining, Nice clean room- bath room could be larger. Coffee pot and hair dryer worked. Slots great!!!!

Who doesn't love the glowing neon of Wendover Will. I stop every single time that I am in town. My most recent visit, it appeared that some of the lights were not functioning. Either way, Will is a must see. The din of I 80 traffic passing by. The winds of the high desert, and the lights of the casinos shimmering just a few blocks away.

On West Wendover Blvd. there is hardly any traffic.Easy to get around any time day or night. not to many stop lights. You might want to use the shuttle also,24 hours a day.
.
Wendover Will greets you on the west side of Wendover. We came in from the east but did find a nicely supplied Smith's grocery store near Will that met many of our needs at a low price.
we've seen him each time we've been in Wendover. It's interesting the first time, but then just becomes the "norm"
I am a old person now but remember going to Wendover as a youth with my parents and seeing the BIG cowboy sign waving as you come in to town and it still does.

This is the coolest guy EVER! We were traveling along Wendover and saw this amazing cowboy along the road. Of course we had to take pictures!
FYI: I'm in love with Wendover Will :)
Wendover Will is a cool guy and makes an otherwise austire place seem welcome and friendly. Wendover would not be the same without him.

review_url_name_title: Interesting statue on the entrance to town
review_url_name_comment: Unsure of the history of this statue, but stopped on roadside to get photo, illuminated at night too!
Not a very long walk from the Rainbow and in the evening there wasn't much traffic so it was easy to get over to the statue. Not very good surrounding light for nighttime photography
Nother to share really. He just stands there when you enter town and lights up at night. The Las Vegas style downtown appeal of Front Street.

Stopped in Wendover for the night. Could see Will from the interstate so we had to go visit him. Very easy access. Very easy to grab a pic of him. His presence brought a smile to a weary traveler. Glad we stopped in!
You MUST see him and get a picture of him and next to him. This is just a big big cowboy that is very unique and unusual.
I enjoyed the casino games. I was a winner with more money at the end of my trip than I took. It was fun.
We took a bunch of photos and selfies here. It was a perfect little stop in our trip. Nothing like the west.

This is really cool! Especially at night. Beautiful retro neon sign at the west end of town. Great for photos with the lights of Wendover in the background. Lights up front and back and is seen from I-80.
I believe is kind of "reference" point, you can easily see the statue from almost every place of town, nice to take a pic as a memento.

Big Statue in the middle of the road. Park car safely and walk over to see front and back. It is my understanding that Wendover Will is lighted at night, see if possible. Near by is the Victory Highway Monuments to see also.
He stands right in the middle of the road.Small area to pull off to get a good picture.Not much in Wendover except casinos.

review_url_name_title: It's ok as far as signs go
review_url_name_comment: I mean, it's a neon sign. In the middle of the road. It's fun and you'll probably want to take a selfie in front of it, but that's about all.
A must while in Wendover, I did a tour and one of the stops was the Wendover Will sign, it is something to see and there is a write up of the history, recommend a photo op
Neat to see it and tell everyone "you've been there". Not much to see in Wendover. Make sure you get a tour of the salt flats and the old airforce base, a piece of history that is quite amazing.
Fun welcome to and thank you for visiting Wendover. Had our pics taken with the iconic figure. Nothing too crazy fun about it other than being part of the Wendover experience.

review_url_name_title: Mr. Wendover Will is pretty cool.
review_url_name_comment:
Mr. Will is pretty cool. Big ol' cowboy statue/sign, made of neon. He is pretty impressive during the day, but more so at night when he is all lit up.
The reception clerk at the hotel says all the locals say Mr. Will is pointing at West Wendover, the town. We took a look the morning we left, and yes, indeed, it appears he is doing so.
Good to visit for a highway stop. Food is nearby, there are casinos if you are so inclined. You can explain to your kids what he has hanging out of his mouth!

I always love to see this iconic sign at the end of the street . It is a flashback to the 50’s and always brings a smile.
You can buy a magnet or key chain of this smiling guy
Wendover Will was a fun stop to take a group photo or a selfie. Our tour guy stopped for us to take our picture.
Stopped by here to take a look then came back at night to see all of the colors. Very nice welcome mascot for the city. Good place to stop for a picture.

It is an iconic blast from the past. Sort of like the old Las Vegas sing or the Reno arch. I think it is great that they have preserved a little of the past in an ever remodeled world. It only takes a second to see but brings back memories of a better time.

review_url_name_title: If you're in the area, might as well stop by. :)
review_url_name_comment: Wendover Will is on the opposite side of town from Montego Bay, but really only about a mile away. We drove to it at night the first time. The kids thought it was really cool to see a 30 ft lit up cowboy in a "gambling" town. Completely different from our town. :) There is a grassy area at the base, so you may take pictures. We parked in front of it, just a little off of the road, which is probably not what the township wants you to do, but the traffic was very light. We hopped out very quickly and took a quick picture.

We loved driving from Utah to Nevada on the old road through Wendover into West Wendover.
It was such a stark contrast literally one side old town quiet then Nevada big brash and riotously alive all summed up by Wendover Will as historically important as Vegas Vic.
A bit of history below from wiki
Pat Denner was commissioned to design the sign for the Stateline Casino in 1952. Denner had just completed the Vegas Vic sign that was erected in 1951. The sign was constructed by The Young Electric Sign Company.
Wendover Will was named after the town of Wendover and William Smith, who founded the Stateline Casino. The 63-foot-tall (19 m) sign was intended to draw travelers in from US Highways 40 and 50, later known as Interstate 80. The sign includes 1,184 feet (361 m) of neon tubing.[2] When driving east on Interstate 80 a caption under the sign reads, "This is the place," apparently in homage to Brigham Young. When driving west the caption reads, "Where the West begins".
Wendover Will waves "howdy" on the Interstate with neon lights turning on at twilight. Can read the inscription while driving.
This is what I love about Nevada...the Neon! And Wendover Willy does not disappoint! So fun to get a picture! And you can get right up close!
Did not realize he was an old icon, until I saw the Movie "Worlds fastest Indian" lol Pretty Neat. that they kept him around.
Stop and say hi to wendover Will. Smile and wave if you must drive by. Check out the Victory road eagle and marked near by. Think of travel along this road in a wagon.

review_url_name_title: So NIce They Saved This Guy
review_url_name_comment: Yes, there was a version of this guy in Vegas, Reno and Wendover at one or another casino. Now he has been saved and stands on his own pedestal on the west side of town. He is just a fun deal to see. He was here when I was a kid like these grandkids. I am still impressed with the old sign after seventy years!
It's cool when he's lit up, but still fun to take pictures. It is free to the public. Wendover is small enough, that you can walk to visit him.

review_url_name_title: A Nastalgic piece of Wendover history
review_url_name_comment: A big tall cowboy facade on the west end near Smith's market. It used to be near the casinos on the East end of Wendover but it was moved years ago.

review_url_name_title: Iconic Wendover Will, West Wendover, Nevada
review_url_name_comment: We went to see Wendover Will, which is a sign landmark for West Wendover. The sign was originally made for the Stateline Casino in 1952. West Wendover is a casino town on the Nevada/Utah border.
Always would see Wendover Will as we drove to California for family vacation. Had to stop by and see him as an adult!

review_url_name_title: Been there, done that and got a photo
review_url_name_comment: Grabbing a photo of waving Wendover Will is a must when you are passing through the town. He is located on the west end of main street, near the liquor store and grocery store.
Great stop for multiple casinos! The statue is easily visible from the highway. The casinos, restaurants, hotels, gas stations and theater are all great and easy access!
Wendover Will is always great to see... Shows the history of Wendover and is always bright at night.

As you ride through the town of Wendover, you will find Wendover Will at the end of the strip. This is a very large figure of a cowboy that is very welcoming and fun for children to see. We were there during the daytime. I think it lights up at night.

review_url_name_title: You can visit the entire town on the shuttle and it friendly and comfortable.
review_url_name_comment: This is one gambling town that will NOT rip you off. The people are nice and the businesses are there to serve you and not just take your money and leave you stranded.

review_url_name_title: Its a great town to visit
review_url_name_comment: They have many hotels, great workers. Friendliness about town . The hotel people go out of their way to help you and make you feel comfortable.

You just have to stop and take a photo of and with this crazy 50s era welcoming cowboy. There is very little to see in west wendover except for casinos so this giant neon guy makes it almost a destination in itself

review_url_name_title: This is what Wendover looks like
review_url_name_comment: This is the most important thing to have your picture taken with in Wendover. Everything else just doesn't matter that much.
Right in the middle of the town road there is Will standing tall it's a great sight to see and you need to visit when your here.
Down the Road Right in the middle close to the Rainbow Casino Awesome to see at night all lite up It's a must to takee pictures
Can be seen from all over town. Very similar to Vegas Vic. Not a lot of sites to see in Wendover, but be sure to add this one to your list.
Play the slots. Good atmosphere with other players. Drinks are available by friendly waitresses. Slots are loose enough so you can play.

we went to see Wendover Bill. He is very big and in the center of the road. It was really quite amazing. They also have a welcome center there that we went in to check out. They let you know about the town, and have pictures and history about town, which I thought very interesting.
Not much to say. It's a large ,lighted sign welcoming you to West Wendover. Makes a good picture for your memories of trip.
A bit crazy, but a nice welcome to the W Wendover area. The town is mostly homes for casino workers, but they do have great Smith's grocery store, and the other handy places.

review_url_name_title: Wanted a photo with Wendover Will
review_url_name_comment: Took a short walk from the Garter Casino to Wendover Will to get a few photos and to take a selfie .Couldnt miss getting a photo in front of him.

review_url_name_title: Kool sign and very interesting historical site right next to it
review_url_name_comment: The sign is visible for miles. It's just up the road from the major SMITHS Market. It's not unusual to see people taking pictures of friends next to it.
Arriving after dark and seeing this iconic piece still here after decades was cool. Took a picture which came out good.
It was cool to find out about the link to Vegas vic and the history.Plus it is within walking distance.
Although there is not a lot to see here, it is a nice stopover. There is a wide shoulder to pull off of the road.
Nice welcome, cute idea Guess he's seen a lot of people Been here many years I imagine. Don't know any history or who made him up.
It was probably in a better spot in its original place at the border but it still looks good where it is now. Easy to take a good photo day or night and worth the effort.

West Wendover seems to be all casino's owned by the same group and little else.
When I went to the Chevron for a car wash it was surrounded by cops so I went in the morning and got a good exterior carwash
Glad Wendover Will is there. The only fun thing in a dreary Casino town.
Will was a site for sore, tired eyes! We had driven for nine hours, ready for rest first, then fun! ...and we did
You can't visit Wendover without visiting the famous Wendover Will Statue! This guy has been around for years!

review_url_name_title: Historic sign used to belong to one casino, the city fixed it up and kept it for everyone.
review_url_name_comment: North of Wendover Will sign, right in front of the new City building, is a historic gravel road with about seven roadside information signs about all the history of this area. Military training area, telephone wires, Lincoln Highway location, railroad tracks, pioneers crossing the salt flats, land speed records set on the salt flats. Allow an hour to read all the interesting information.

Drove over from Utah just because I could. Stopped in Wendover, and while at the visitor center, saw a post card of Will. The lady at the visitor center proceeded to tell me his history. After that, I just had to see for myself. Pretty cool icon.
Just off the main road, so it worth the 1 minute drive up the road.
Snapped my pic with Will and headed back to SLC. Pretty cool day.
OK...its a 50' neon sign, right in the median of Wendover Boulevard...that's it! No, this isn't a day trip, however, it is another tribute to the excess of the Nevada gambling industry.

review_url_name_title: Should be at the other end of town.
review_url_name_comment: I remember being a kid and this sign would greet you coming in to Wendover from Utah and it was a thrill to see, BUT now it's at the other end of town and out of sight, not where it should be!
Of course every town should have a mascot ...this is a great entry to the town . I have nothing else to say about this.

review_url_name_title: Best little gambling town in Nevada
review_url_name_comment: Montego Bay for the pool & Jacuzzi. Rainbow Casino for gambling and Peppermill for all around gambling

review_url_name_title: He is a Cute Roadside Attraction
review_url_name_comment: We knew he would be there, so it wasn't a surprise. Cute anomaly for those unaware of his existence.

review_url_name_title: Stop and read the historical markers
review_url_name_comment: Stop and read the historical markers, also take a picture of Wendover Willy for nostalgia's sake. Quirky stops like this are disappearing fast.

review_url_name_title: Just something fun and a bit historical
review_url_name_comment: Not a huge thing, but a cool thing. It's an homage to a founding citizen of West Wendover. It's just cute and fun.

review_url_name_title: Embrace Your Touristy Side and Snap a Shot
review_url_name_comment: It's one of those things that you think, well, it's here, might as well take a photo of it! Wendover Will doesn't really have a "wow" factor, but he's fun to take a souvenir photo of nonetheless. I wouldn't consider this an attraction, but more of a two minute snapshot just for fun.
This is a fun stop to take pictures for a souvenir of your visit to West Wendover. Good for all ages!
Reminds me of the cowboy down in Vegas. Small America trying to leave its own mark to be remembered.

Huge welcome sign decked out in neon lights.
Not much here really but you cannot miss it if coming into town.
Part of roadside America for sure.
Walk over from the Red Garter and immerse yourself in some city history. I love knowing about the places I visit. There are several plaques to read and be greeted by Will.

Wendover Will is an local town icon for over a century. A must see and snap a picture of the huge icon. He's arm was not moving the day I was there but the cigarette was a waving back and forth at night. Truly a great quick 2 minute stop at the end of town.

review_url_name_title: Tin and neon is at the heart of this Nevada triplet
review_url_name_comment: Resurrected and restored, Wendover will stands at the edge of casino row, waiting to be gazed at and photographed. Luckily the road he's on isn't too busy, he sits in the middle with an ambiguous space of asphalt which is unlikely a safe place to park, but deters no one from just stopping. He has two brothers made by Young Electric Sign Co: Vegas Vic, (downtown Vegas) and River Rick (Laughlin NV). A must see, and the easiest way / beacon to find Smiths, when you run out of beef jerky and bourbon.
If you visit Wendover, you'll most likely spot him. He's tall and stands out, especially at night. An icon of a bygone era that still lives on.
The electric cowboy with the waiving arm has been here "forever." He is iconic. He is a fun "sight."
The cool thing about Wendover Will is that the 63-year-old icon has been preserved, but placed on the western outskirts of town. A cousin of "Vegas Vic" Will is no longer animated.

review_url_name_title: The Single Attraction in West Wendover
review_url_name_comment: How this is not the number one attraction here escapes me. I mean, besides hanging out at the Love's Truck Stop, this is THE THING to see and do here in West Wendover. If you are staying here, it is a MUST SEE.

Wendover sits along legendary roads of passage across the desert and salt flats. At the Montego Bay Casino, there's a restored Lincoln Hwy marker--a later alignment of the Lincoln was routed to Wendover then down to Ely. And Wendover was also along the Victory Hwy (back when roads had names not numbers), named for the WW1 veterans. Wendover Will used to sit by one of the casinos some years ago, but now he has been relocated to the west side of town, on the old highway leading out to rejoin the interstate. It's nice to see a remnant of the old road culture survive in 2015.
Great land mark, good to send selfi photo to friends or family.Island area well kept and clean, nice job Wendover!

Not too much to say about him. We saw him, stopped and took a photo.
He is certainly tall and you can not miss him.
as you are driving you come across a big waving cowboy,how could you not like it? We took the obligatory picture and drove on .
Whenever we drive near Wendover we always take a drive by Will...I know it's cheesy but we like driving past the welcome (or goodbye) of Wendover Will, haha
We stopped and took photos in front of Wendover Will. Good photo stop while sightseeing in the Wendover area. Also has historical markers nearby.

We stopped and were goofing around posing for pictures with "Wendover Will" which seemed to be drawing an audience. People were honking and waving as they drove by. This is a fun landmark in the west part of town.

Just past the Casinos on the Wendover strips in the middle of highway 80 sits Wendover Will.He is a Carbon copy of Vegas Vic. There is a place to park and get out to see him and take pictures. We stopped in the day time and them came back at night when he is all lit up with Neon. When in Wendover you must see this.
